title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Mt. Blue Middle School principal James Black criticized for wearing an ICE agent costume at a Halloween event.
Superintendent Christian Elkington confirms the incident occurred off school grounds and the district is addressing it internally.
Project Relief Maine and others express concern over the costume, citing fear it may instill in immigrant students.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez left the Patriots' game with a head injury but was cleared to return after concussion protocol.
The injury occurred as Gonzalez covered Atlanta's Drake London, resulting in a 40-yard catch and minor head impact.
The Patriots won the game by one point, helped by a missed Falcons' extra point, marking their closest win of the season.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End residents removed 180 needles in six days from Southwest Corridor Park, highlighting safety concerns.
City official Ed Flynn calls for reducing needle distribution after residents' safety plea at public meeting.
Boston distributes over 81,000 needles monthly as harm reduction; residents demand increased needle pick-up efforts.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant praises Jayson Tatum's rapid recovery from an Achilles injury, noting advanced rehab techniques.
Tatum, recovering just six months post-surgery, is already dunking, a feat Durant didn't reach early in his recovery.
Durant believes Tatum may return during the 2025-26 season, but advises a cautious, day-by-day approach.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings played with heavy hearts in Patriots' 24-23 victory over the Falcons.
Douglas achieved his first 100-yard game after learning of his uncle's passing the previous night.
Jennings, signed from the practice squad, scored his first NFL touchdown amid the emotional game.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots win 24-23 against Falcons despite two turnovers by quarterback Drake Maye leading to 10 Atlanta points.
Coach Mike Vrabel emphasizes joy and positivity in his post-game speech, encouraging players to value these moments.
Drake Maye throws for 259 yards and two touchdowns but commits turnovers amid issues with pass protection and execution.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren, first African American to lead a Massachusetts city, died unexpectedly at 55.
Warren served Newton as mayor from 2009 to 2018, focusing on education, transportation, and environmental initiatives.
A Harvard lecturer and public policy advocate, Warren is remembered for his dedication to community and public service.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots extended their win streak to six with a closer-than-expected victory over the Falcons.
DeMario Douglas had his first career 100-yard game, including a 58-yard catch from quarterback Drake Maye.
The Patriots' offensive line struggled, allowing six sacks and forcing quarterback Drake Maye into turnovers.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston residents report feeling safer downtown, with 33.7% feeling 'less safe' compared to 70.6% in November 2024.
Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit addressed issues like drug use, petty crime, and infrastructure at the Emerson Cutler Majestic Theatre.
Retail vacancies in downtown Boston are at their lowest since the COVID-19 pandemic, indicating improved safety perception.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots narrowly defeated the Atlanta Falcons 24-23, extending their win streak to six games.
Drake Maye recorded 259 passing yards and two touchdowns, but his turnovers led to 10 points for Atlanta.
Parker Romo's missed extra-point attempt kept the game at 24-23, preventing overtime and securing the Patriots' victory.
